00041 /* Private constants ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00042 /** @defgroup ADC_Private_Define ADC private definitions
00043   * @{
00044   */
00045 #define ADC_ENABLE_BIT       (0x00000080)
00046 #define DUAL_MODE_MASK       (0x00000003)
00047 #define ADC_SOFTWARE_RESET   (0x00000001)
00048 #define LST_SEQ_SET          (0x0000001F)
00049 #define TCR_SC_SET           (0x00000001)
00050 
00051 #define HLST_SEQ_SET         (0x0000001F)
00052 #define HTCR_SC_SET          (0x00000001)
00053 
00054 #define OFR_ADOF_MASK        (0x00000FFF)
00055 #define OFR_ADAL             (1 << 14)
00056 #define OFR_ADOFE            (1 << 15)
00057 /**
00058   * @}
00059   */
00060 
00061 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00062 /** @addtogroup ADC_Exported_Functions ADC exported functions
00063   * @{
00064   */
00065 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00066  * @brief Deinitialize the HT_ADCn peripheral registers to their default reset values.
00067  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00068  * @retval None
00069  ************************************************************************************************************/
00070 void ADC_DeInit(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn)
00071 {
00072   RSTCU_PeripReset_TypeDef RSTCUReset = {{0}};
00073 
00074   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00075   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00076 
00077   if (HT_ADCn == HT_ADC0)
00078   {
00079     RSTCUReset.Bit.ADC0 = 1;
00080   }
00081   #if (LIBCFG_ADC1)
00082   else if (HT_ADCn == HT_ADC1)
00083   {
00084     RSTCUReset.Bit.ADC1 = 1;
00085   }
00086   #endif
00087   RSTCU_PeripReset(RSTCUReset, ENABLE);
00088 }
00089 
00090 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00091  * @brief Reset ADC.
00092  * @param HT_ADCn: is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00093  * @retval None
00094  ************************************************************************************************************/
00095 void ADC_Reset(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn)
00096 {
00097   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00098   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00099 
00100   HT_ADCn->RST |= ADC_SOFTWARE_RESET;
00101 }
00102 
00103 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00104  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified ADC.
00105  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00106  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00107  * @retval None
00108  ************************************************************************************************************/
00109 void ADC_Cmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00110 {
00111   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00112   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00113   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00114 
00115   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00116   {
00117     HT_ADCn->CONV |= ADC_ENABLE_BIT;
00118   }
00119   else
00120   {
00121     HT_ADCn->CONV &= ~(ADC_ENABLE_BIT);
00122   }
00123 }
00124 
00125 #if (LIBCFG_ADC1)
00126 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00127  * @brief Configure the ADC dual mode.
00128  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals. (ADC1 only)
00129  * @param DUAL_X: ADC dual mode configuration.
00130  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00131  *     @arg DUAL_INDEPENDENT                : Independent mode (dual mode off).
00132  *     @arg DUAL_CASCADE_REGULAR            : Cascade mode in regular conversion.
00133  *     @arg DUAL_CASCADE_REGULAR_H_PRIORITY : Cascade mode in regular/high priority conversion.
00134  * @param HDelayTime: High priority ADC trigger delay.
00135  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00136  * @param DelayTime: Regular ADC trigger delay.
00137  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00138  * @retval None
00139  ************************************************************************************************************/
00140 void ADC_DualModeConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 DUAL_X, u8 HDelayTime, u8 DelayTime)
00141 {
00142   u32 uTmpReg1, uTmpReg2;
00143   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00144   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00145   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_DUAL_MODE(DUAL_X));
00146 
00147   uTmpReg1 = HT_ADCn->CFGR;
00148   uTmpReg2 = (DUAL_MODE_MASK | 0x00FFFF00);
00149   uTmpReg1 &= ~uTmpReg2;
00150   uTmpReg2 = (DUAL_X | HDelayTime << 16 | DelayTime << 8);
00151   uTmpReg1 |= uTmpReg2;
00152 
00153   HT_ADCn->CFGR = uTmpReg1;
00154 }
00155 #endif
00156 
00157 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00158  * @brief Configure conversion mode and length of list queue for regular group.
00159  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00160  * @param ADC_MODE: ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode.
00161  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00162  *     @arg ONE_SHOT_MODE      :
00163  *     @arg CONTINUOUS_MODE    :
00164  *     @arg DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
00165  * @param Length: must between 1 ~ 16
00166  * @param SubLength: must between 1 ~ 16, only valid for DISCONTINUOUS_MODE.
00167  * @retval None
00168  ************************************************************************************************************/
00169 void ADC_RegularGroupConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_MODE, u8 Length, u8 SubLength)
00170 {
00171   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00172   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00173   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CONVERSION_MODE(ADC_MODE));
00174   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_LENGTH(Length));
00175   if (ADC_MODE == DISCONTINUOUS_MODE)
00176   {
00177     Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_SUB_LENGTH(SubLength));
00178   }
00179 
00180   /* Config cyclic conversion mode and length of list queue and sub length for regular group                */
00181   HT_ADCn->CONV = ((u32)(SubLength - 1) << 16) | ((u32)(Length - 1) << 8) | ADC_MODE | (HT_ADCn->CONV & ADC_ENABLE_BIT);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00185  * @brief Configure conversion mode and length of list queue for high priority group.
00186  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00187  * @param ADC_MODE: ADC Cyclic Conversion Mode.
00188  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00189  *     @arg ONE_SHOT_MODE      :
00190  *     @arg CONTINUOUS_MODE    :
00191  *     @arg DISCONTINUOUS_MODE :
00192  * @param Length: must between 1 ~ 4
00193  * @param SubLength: must between 1 ~ 4
00194  * @retval None
00195  ************************************************************************************************************/
00196 void ADC_HPGroupConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_MODE, u8 Length, u8 SubLength)
00197 {
00198   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00199   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00200   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CONVERSION_MODE(ADC_MODE));
00201   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_HP_LENGTH(Length));
00202   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_HP_SUB_LENGTH(SubLength));
00203 
00204   /* Config cyclic conversion mode and length of list queue and sub length for regular group                */
00205   HT_ADCn->HCONV = ((u32)(SubLength - 1) << 16) | ((u32)(Length - 1) << 8) | ADC_MODE;
00206 }
00207 
00208 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00209  * @brief Configure the corresponding rank in the sequencer and the sampling time for the regular channel
00210  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00211  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00212  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00213  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel x selected, x must between 0 ~ 7
00214  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00215  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00216  * @param Rank: The rank in the regular group sequencer.
00217  *   This parameter must be between 0 to 7.
00218  * @param SampleClock: Number of sampling clocks.
00219  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00220  * @retval None
00221  ************************************************************************************************************/
00222 void ADC_RegularChannelConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, u8 Rank, u8 SampleClock)
00223 {
00224   u32 tmpreg1, tmpreg2;
00225 
00226   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00227   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00228   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00229   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_RANK(Rank));
00230   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INPUT_SAMPLING_TIME(SampleClock));
00231 
00232   /* config sampling clock of correspond ADC input channel                                                  */
00233   HT_ADCn->STR[ADC_CH_n] = SampleClock;
00234 
00235   /* Get the old register value                                                                             */
00236   tmpreg1 = HT_ADCn->LST[Rank >> 2];
00237   /* Calculate the mask to clear                                                                            */
00238   tmpreg2 = LST_SEQ_SET << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00239   /* Clear the old SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                          */
00240   tmpreg1 &= ~tmpreg2;
00241   /* Calculate the mask to set                                                                              */
00242   tmpreg2 = (u32)ADC_CH_n << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00243   /* Set the SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                                */
00244   tmpreg1 |= tmpreg2;
00245   /* Store the new register value                                                                           */
00246   HT_ADCn->LST[Rank >> 2] = tmpreg1;
00247 }
00248 
00249 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00250  * @brief Configure the corresponding rank in the sequencer and the sample time for the High Priority channel
00251  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00252  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00253  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00254  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel x selected, x must between 0 ~ 7
00255  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00256  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00257  * @param Rank: The rank in the high priority group sequencer.
00258  *   This parameter must be between 0 to 3.
00259  * @param SampleClock: Number of sampling clocks.
00260  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00261  * @retval None
00262  ************************************************************************************************************/
00263 void ADC_HPChannelConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, u8 Rank, u8 SampleClock)
00264 {
00265   u32 tmpreg1, tmpreg2;
00266 
00267   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00268   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00269   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00270   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_HP_RANK(Rank));
00271   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INPUT_SAMPLING_TIME(SampleClock));
00272 
00273   /* config sampling clock of correspond ADC input channel                                                  */
00274   HT_ADCn->STR[ADC_CH_n] = SampleClock;
00275 
00276   /* Get the old register value                                                                             */
00277   tmpreg1 = HT_ADCn->HLST;
00278   /* Calculate the mask to clear                                                                            */
00279   tmpreg2 = HLST_SEQ_SET << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00280   /* Clear the old SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                          */
00281   tmpreg1 &= ~tmpreg2;
00282   /* Calculate the mask to set                                                                              */
00283   tmpreg2 = (u32)ADC_CH_n << (8 * (Rank & 0x3));
00284   /* Set the SEQx bits for the selected rank                                                                */
00285   tmpreg1 |= tmpreg2;
00286   /* Store the new register value                                                                           */
00287   HT_ADCn->HLST = tmpreg1;
00288 }
00289 
00290 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00291  * @brief Configure the ADC trigger source for regular channels conversion.
00292  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00293  * @param ADC_TRIG_x:
00294  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00295  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE        : S/W trigger
00296  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n          : where n can be 0 ~ 15
00297  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MEVx      : where n can be 0
00298  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_DMEVx     : where n can be 0*
00299  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_MEVxDEVz  : where n can be 0
00300  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO       : where n can be 0
00301  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O      : where n can be 0
00302  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O      : where n can be 0
00303  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O      : where n can be 0
00304  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O      : where n can be 0
00305  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMEV    : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00306  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmDEV    : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00307  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMDEV   : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00308  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMEV  : where n can be 0
00309  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLDEV  : where n can be 0
00310  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMDEV : where n can be 0
00311  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_BFTMn           : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00312  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO       : where n can be 0
00313  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O      : where n can be 0
00314  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O      : where n can be 0
00315  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O      : where n can be 0
00316  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O      : where n can be 0
00317  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_CMPn            : where n can be 0 ~ 3
00318  * @retval None
00319  ************************************************************************************************************/
00320 void ADC_RegularTrigConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_TRIG_x)
00321 {
00322   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00323   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00324   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_TRIG(ADC_TRIG_x));
00325 
00326   /* Config external trigger conversion source of regular group                                             */
00327   HT_ADCn->TCR = ADC_TRIG_x & 0x0000001F;
00328   HT_ADCn->TSR = ADC_TRIG_x & (~0x0000001F);
00329 }
00330 
00331 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00332  * @brief Configure the ADC trigger source for high priority channels conversion.
00333  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00334  * @param ADC_TRIG_x:
00335  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00336  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_SOFTWARE        : S/W trigger
00337  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_EXTI_n          : where n can be 0 ~ 15
00338  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MEVx      : where n can be 0
00339  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_DMEVx     : where n can be 0*
00340  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTM0_MEVxDEVz  : where n can be 0
00341  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_MTO       : where n can be 0
00342  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH0O      : where n can be 0
00343  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH1O      : where n can be 0
00344  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH2O      : where n can be 0
00345  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CH3O      : where n can be 0
00346  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMEV    : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00347  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmDEV    : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00348  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHmMDEV   : where n can be 0, m can be 0 ~ 3
00349  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMEV  : where n can be 0
00350  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLDEV  : where n can be 0
00351  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_MCTMn_CHALLMDEV : where n can be 0
00352  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_BFTMn           : where n can be 0 ~ 1
00353  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_MTO       : where n can be 0
00354  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH0O      : where n can be 0
00355  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH1O      : where n can be 0
00356  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH2O      : where n can be 0
00357  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_GPTMn_CH3O      : where n can be 0
00358  *     @arg ADC_TRIG_CMPn            : where n can be 0 ~ 3
00359  * @retval None
00360  ************************************************************************************************************/
00361 void ADC_HPTrigConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_TRIG_x)
00362 {
00363   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00364   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00365   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_TRIG(ADC_TRIG_x));
00366 
00367   HT_ADCn->HTCR = ADC_TRIG_x & 0x0000001F;
00368   HT_ADCn->HTSR = ADC_TRIG_x & (~0x0000001F);
00369 }

00371 #if (!LIBCFG_ADC_NO_OFFSET_REG)
00372 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00373  * @brief Configure the channel data alignment format.
00374  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00375  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00376  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00377  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel x selected
00378  *     @arg ADC_CH_OPAn     : ADC channel for OPAn
00379  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00380  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00381  * @param ADC_ALIGN_x: ADC_ALIGN_RIGHT or ADC_ALIGN_LEFT
00382  * @retval None
00383  ************************************************************************************************************/
00384 void ADC_ChannelDataAlign(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, ADC_ALIGN_Enum ADC_ALIGN_x)
00385 {
00386   u32 OFRValue;
00387 
00388   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00389   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00390   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00391   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_ALIGN(ADC_ALIGN_x));
00392 
00393   OFRValue = HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] & (~(OFR_ADAL));
00394   OFRValue |= ADC_ALIGN_x;
00395 
00396   HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] = OFRValue;
00397 }
00398 
00399 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00400  * @brief Configure the offset value for channel offset cancellation.
00401  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00402  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00403  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00404  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel x selected
00405  *     @arg ADC_CH_OPAn     : ADC channel for OPAn
00406  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00407  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00408  * @param OffsetValue: The offset value
00409  * @retval None
00410  ************************************************************************************************************/
00411 void ADC_ChannelOffsetValue(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, u16 OffsetValue)
00412 {
00413   u32 OFRValue;
00414 
00415   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00416   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00417   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00418   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_OFFSET(OffsetValue));
00419 
00420   OFRValue = HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] & (~OFR_ADOF_MASK);
00421   OFRValue |= (OffsetValue & 0xFFF);
00422   HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] = OFRValue;
00423 }
00424 
00425 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00426  * @brief Enable or Disable the channel offset cancellation function.
00427  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00428  * @param ADC_CH_n: the ADC channel to configure
00429  *   This parameter can be one of the following values:
00430  *     @arg ADC_CH_n        : ADC Channel x selected
00431  *     @arg ADC_CH_OPAn     : ADC channel for OPAn
00432  *     @arg ADC_CH_GND_VREF : ADC GND VREF selected
00433  *     @arg ADC_CH_VDD_VREF : ADC VDD VREF selected
00434  * @param NewState: ENABLE DISABLE
00435  * @retval None
00436  ************************************************************************************************************/
00437 void ADC_ChannelOffsetCmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n, ControlStatus NewState)
00438 {
00439   u32 OFRValue;
00440 
00441   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00442   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00443   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00444   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00445 
00446   OFRValue = HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] & (~(OFR_ADOFE));
00447 
00448   if (NewState == ENABLE)
00449   {
00450     OFRValue |= OFR_ADOFE;
00451   }
00452 
00453   HT_ADCn->OFR[ADC_CH_n] = OFRValue;
00454 }
00455 #endif
00456 
00457 #if (LIBCFG_ADC_TRIG_DELAY)
00458 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00459  * @brief Configure the ADC Trigger Delay.
00460  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals. (ADC1 only)
00461   * @param HDelayTime: High priority ADC trigger delay.
00462  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00463  * @param DelayTime: Regular ADC trigger delay.
00464  *   This parameter must be between 0x00 to 0xFF.
00465  * @retval None
00466  ************************************************************************************************************/
00467 void ADC_TrigDelayConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 HDelayTime, u8 DelayTime)
00468 {
00469   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00470   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00471 
00472   HT_ADCn->CFGR = (HDelayTime << 16 | DelayTime << 8);
00473 }
00474 #endif
00475 
00476 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00477  * @brief Enable or Disable software start of the regular channel conversion of the selected ADC.
00478  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00479  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00480  * @retval None
00481  ************************************************************************************************************/
00482 void ADC_SoftwareStartConvCmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00483 {
00484   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00485   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00486   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00487 
00488   /* Start Conversion                                                                                       */
00489   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00490   {
00491     HT_ADCn->TSR |= TCR_SC_SET;
00492   }
00493   else
00494   {
00495     HT_ADCn->TSR &= ~TCR_SC_SET;
00496   }
00497 }
00498 
00499 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00500  * @brief Enable or Disable software start of the high priority channel conversion of the selected ADC.
00501  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00502  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00503  * @retval None
00504  ************************************************************************************************************/
00505 void ADC_HPSoftwareStartConvCmd(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, ControlStatus NewState)
00506 {
00507   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00508   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00509   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00510 
00511   /* Start Conversion                                                                                       */
00512   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00513   {
00514     HT_ADCn->HTSR |= HTCR_SC_SET;
00515   }
00516   else
00517   {
00518     HT_ADCn->HTSR &= ~HTCR_SC_SET;
00519   }
00520 }
00521 
00522 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00523  * @brief Return the result of ADC regular channel conversion.
00524  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00525  * @param ADC_REGULAR_DATAn: where n can be 0 ~ 7
00526  * @retval The Value of data conversion.
00527  ************************************************************************************************************/
00528 u16 ADC_GetConversionData(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_REGULAR_DATAn)
00529 {
00530   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00531   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00532   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_REGULAR_DATA(ADC_REGULAR_DATAn));
00533 
00534   return ((u16)HT_ADCn->DR[ADC_REGULAR_DATAn]);
00535 }
00536 
00537 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00538  * @brief Return the result of ADC high priority channel conversion.
00539  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00540  * @param ADC_HP_DATAn: where x can be 0 ~ 3
00541  * @retval The Value of data conversion.
00542  ************************************************************************************************************/
00543 u16 ADC_GetHPConversionData(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_HP_DATAn)
00544 {
00545   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00546   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00547   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_HP_DATA(ADC_HP_DATAn));
00548 
00549   return ((u16)HT_ADCn->HDR[ADC_HP_DATAn]);
00550 }
00551 
00552 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00553  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified ADC interrupts.
00554  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00555  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the ADC interrupt sources that is to be enabled or disabled.
00556  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00557  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00558  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00559  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00560  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SINGLE_EOC     :
00561  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SUB_GROUP_EOC  :
00562  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_CYCLE_EOC      :
00563  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00564  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_DATA_OVERWRITE :
00565  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00566  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00567  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00568  * @retval None
00569  ************************************************************************************************************/
00570 void ADC_IntConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00571 {
00572   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00573   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00574   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00575   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00576 
00577   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00578   {
00579     HT_ADCn->IER |= ADC_INT_x;
00580   }
00581   else
00582   {
00583     HT_ADCn->IER &= ~ADC_INT_x;
00584   }
00585 }
00586 
00587 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00588  * @brief Check whether the specified ADC interrupt has occurred.
00589  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00590  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the interrupt status to check.
00591  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00592  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00593  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00594  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00595  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SINGLE_EOC     :
00596  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SUB_GROUP_EOC  :
00597  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_CYCLE_EOC      :
00598  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00599  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_DATA_OVERWRITE :
00600  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00601  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00602  * @retval SET or RESET
00603  ************************************************************************************************************/
00604 FlagStatus ADC_GetIntStatus(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x)
00605 {
00606   FlagStatus Status;
00607 
00608   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00609   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00610   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00611 
00612   if ((HT_ADCn->ISR & ADC_INT_x) != RESET)
00613   {
00614     Status = SET;
00615   }
00616   else
00617   {
00618     Status = RESET;
00619   }
00620 
00621   return Status;
00622 }
00623 
00624 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00625  * @brief Clear the ADC interrupt pending bits.
00626  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00627  * @param ADC_INT_x: Specify the interrupt pending bits to be cleared.
00628  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00629  *     @arg ADC_INT_SINGLE_EOC        :
00630  *     @arg ADC_INT_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00631  *     @arg ADC_INT_CYCLE_EOC         :
00632  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SINGLE_EOC     :
00633  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_SUB_GROUP_EOC  :
00634  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_CYCLE_EOC      :
00635  *     @arg ADC_INT_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00636  *     @arg ADC_INT_HP_DATA_OVERWRITE :
00637  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_LOWER         :
00638  *     @arg ADC_INT_AWD_UPPER         :
00639  * @retval None
00640  ************************************************************************************************************/
00641 void ADC_ClearIntPendingBit(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_INT_x)
00642 {
00643   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00644   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00645   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INT(ADC_INT_x));
00646 
00647   HT_ADCn->ICLR = ADC_INT_x;
00648 }
00649 
00650 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00651  * @brief Check whether the specified ADC flag has been set.
00652  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00653  * @param ADC_FLAG_x: Specify the flag to check.
00654  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00655  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_SINGLE_EOC        :
00656  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_SUB_GROUP_EOC     :
00657  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_CYCLE_EOC         :
00658  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_HP_SINGLE_EOC     :
00659  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_HP_SUB_GROUP_EOC  :
00660  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_HP_CYCLE_EOC      :
00661  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_DATA_OVERWRITE    :
00662  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_HP_DATA_OVERWRITE :
00663  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_AWD_LOWER         :
00664  *     @arg ADC_FLAG_AWD_UPPER         :
00665  * @retval SET or RESET
00666  ************************************************************************************************************/
00667 FlagStatus ADC_GetFlagStatus(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_FLAG_x)
00668 {
00669   FlagStatus Status;
00670 
00671   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00672   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00673   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_FLAG(ADC_FLAG_x));
00674 
00675   if ((HT_ADCn->IRAW & ADC_FLAG_x) != RESET)
00676   {
00677     Status = SET;
00678   }
00679   else
00680   {
00681     Status = RESET;
00682   }
00683 
00684   return Status;
00685 }
00686 
00687 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00688  * @brief Enable or Disable Lower/Upper threshold warning of the analog watchdog on single/all channels.
00689  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00690  * @param ADC_AWD_x:
00691  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00692  *     @arg ADC_AWD_DISABLE            :
00693  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER          :
00694  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_UPPER          :
00695  *     @arg ADC_AWD_ALL_LOWER_UPPER    :
00696  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER       :
00697  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_UPPER       :
00698  *     @arg ADC_AWD_SINGLE_LOWER_UPPER :
00699  * @retval None
00700  ************************************************************************************************************/
00701 void ADC_AWDConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_AWD_x)
00702 {
00703   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00704   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00705   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_AWD(ADC_AWD_x));
00706 
00707   HT_ADCn->WCR = (HT_ADCn->WCR & 0xFFFFFFF8) | ADC_AWD_x;
00708 }
00709 
00710 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00711  * @brief Configure the analog watchdog that guards single channel.
00712  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00713  * @param ADC_CH_n: where n must between 0 ~ 7
00714  * @retval None
00715  ************************************************************************************************************/
00716 void ADC_AWDSingleChannelConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u8 ADC_CH_n)
00717 {
00718   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00719   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00720   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_INPUT_CHANNEL(ADC_CH_n));
00721 
00722   HT_ADCn->WCR = (HT_ADCn->WCR & 0xFFFFF0FF) | ((u32)ADC_CH_n << 8);
00723 }
00724 
00725 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00726  * @brief Configure the high and low thresholds of the analog watchdog.
00727  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00728  * @param UPPER: must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
00729  * @param LOWER: must between 0x0000 ~ 0x0FFF
00730  * @retval None
00731  ************************************************************************************************************/
00732 void ADC_AWDThresholdsConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u16 UPPER, u16 LOWER)
00733 {
00734   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00735   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00736   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_THRESHOLD(UPPER));
00737   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_THRESHOLD(LOWER));
00738 
00739   HT_ADCn->LTR = LOWER;
00740   HT_ADCn->UTR = UPPER;
00741 }
00742 
00743 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00744  * @brief Enable or Disable the specified PDMA request.
00745  * @param HT_ADCn: where HT_ADCn is the selected ADC from the ADC peripherals.
00746  * @param ADC_PDMA_x: Specify the ADC PDMA request that is to be enabled or disabled.
00747  *   This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
00748  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_REGULAR_SINGLE   :
00749  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_REGULAR_SUBGROUP :
00750  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_REGULAR_CYCLE    :
00751  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_HP_SINGLE        :
00752  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_HP_SUBGROUP      :
00753  *     @arg ADC_PDMA_HP_CYCLE         :
00754  * @param NewState: This parameter can be ENABLE or DISABLE.
00755  * @retval None
00756  ************************************************************************************************************/
00757 void ADC_PDMAConfig(HT_ADC_TypeDef* HT_ADCn, u32 ADC_PDMA_x, ControlStatus NewState)
00758 {
00759   /* Check the parameters                                                                                   */
00760   Assert_Param(IS_ADC(HT_ADCn));
00761   Assert_Param(IS_ADC_PDMA(ADC_PDMA_x));
00762   Assert_Param(IS_CONTROL_STATUS(NewState));
00763 
00764   if (NewState != DISABLE)
00765   {
00766     HT_ADCn->PDMAR |= ADC_PDMA_x;
00767   }
00768   else
00769   {
00770     HT_ADCn->PDMAR &= ~ADC_PDMA_x;
00771   }
00772 }
